<<<api>>>: Collections.min()
<<<code>>>: Collections.min(Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3, 4, 5));
<<<explanation>>>: The formal parameter of type Collection<? extends T> allows for a more flexible and generic implementation of the method. By using <? extends T>, the method can work with any collection that contains elements of type T or a subclass of T, whereas using Collection<T> would only allow for collections of type T. This allows for the method to work with more types of collections, such as a List of Objects that contains Integer objects, without having to change the method signature.
